message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.CV 

The paper discusses a lifelong learning system that leverages a content-addressable memory to encode both episodic and semantic knowledge over an unbounded number of domains. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) category, as it deals with a connectionist system and its long-term memory. Additionally, the paper discusses transfer learning, which is a common topic in the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. The paper also deals with knowledge representation and natural language processing, which are topics covered in the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Computation and Language (cs.CL) categories, respectively. Finally, the paper mentions the use of memory in computer vision, which suggests that it may also belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) category.
